leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 数值相对论与宇宙尺度计算物理生态
leaf_cluster.typical_objects: 时空度规/曲率, 引力波波形, N-body/LSS, 宇宙学网格场
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 建模→高精仿真→波形/统计→推断→benchmark
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 专用仿真器 + 波形/后处理 + 推断/采样 + HPC

unit.unit_name: 推断与统计：采样、贝叶斯、似然与压缩

queries: [WEB] gravitational wave parameter estimation software github

tools.name: DR6-ACT-lite
tools.one_line_profile: Cobaya likelihood module for ACT DR6 foreground-marginalized data
tools.detailed_description: A Cobaya likelihood package designed for analyzing the DR6 foreground-marginalized data from the Atacama Cosmology Telescope (ACT). It enables cosmological parameter inference by integrating ACT data into the Cobaya Bayesian analysis framework.

tools.name: BayesLIM
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Bayesian forward modeling for Line Intensity Mapping
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable, end-to-end Bayesian forward modeling framework designed for Line Intensity Mapping (LIM) cosmology. It facilitates parameter inference and field reconstruction by modeling the connection between underlying cosmological fields and observed intensity maps.

tools.name: Cobaya
tools.one_line_profile: Code for Bayesian Analysis in Cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose Bayesian analysis code for cosmology and astrophysics. It orchestrates the sampling of posterior distributions using various samplers (MCMC, PolyChord) and computes likelihoods from cosmological theories and experiments.

tools.name: gwpopulation
tools.one_line_profile: Gravitational-wave population inference library
tools.detailed_description: A CPU/GPU agnostic Python library for performing hierarchical Bayesian inference on gravitational-wave populations. It allows users to constrain population hyperparameters using data from individual gravitational-wave events.

tools.name: CHIMERA
tools.one_line_profile: Hierarchical inference model for EM and GW analysis
tools.detailed_description: Combined Hierarchical Inference Model for Electromagnetic and gRavitational Wave Analysis. A tool designed for joint analysis of electromagnetic and gravitational wave data to infer cosmological parameters and source properties.

tools.name: MGCosmoPop
tools.one_line_profile: Hierarchical Bayesian inference for Modified Gravity and Cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A hierarchical Bayesian inference package for constraining the Hubble constant, modified gravitational wave propagation, and binary black hole population models using gravitational wave observations.

tools.name: GWInferno
tools.one_line_profile: Gravitational-Wave Hierarchical Inference with NumPyro
tools.detailed_description: A Python library leveraging NumPyro for efficient hierarchical inference of gravitational-wave populations. It utilizes JAX for hardware acceleration and automatic differentiation to speed up the inference process.

tools.name: hera_pspec
tools.one_line_profile: Power spectrum estimation for HERA
tools.detailed_description: A library for estimating the power spectrum of radio astronomy data, specifically designed for the Hydrogen Epoch of Reionization Array (HERA). It includes tools for data handling, power spectrum estimation, and analysis.

tools.name: dot-PE
tools.one_line_profile: Likelihood factorization based GW inference
tools.detailed_description: A tool for performing parameter estimation (inference) on gravitational wave compact object coalescence events. It employs likelihood factorization, sampling, and matrix multiplication techniques to analyze GW data.

tools.name: bayesian-pipelines-pixels
tools.one_line_profile: Pixel-level Bayesian cosmological inference
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for performing Bayesian cosmological inference directly from pixel-level data. Developed within the LSST Dark Energy Science Collaboration (DESC) to extract cosmological information from survey images.

tools.name: firecrown
tools.one_line_profile: DESC Cosmology Likelihood Framework
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that provides a framework for implementing and evaluating cosmological likelihoods. It is designed to interface with sampling frameworks like Cobaya and CosmoSIS, focusing on LSST DESC science cases.

tools.name: MontePython_desilike
tools.one_line_profile: DESI BAO likelihood for MontePython
tools.detailed_description: An adaptation of the DESI (Dark Energy Spectroscopic Instrument) Baryon Acoustic Oscillation (BAO) likelihood for use within the MontePython cosmological inference code.

tools.name: amplfi
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning based GW parameter estimation
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing parameter estimation on gravitational wave data using machine learning techniques, specifically designed to accelerate inference compared to traditional sampling methods.

tools.name: allesfitter
tools.one_line_profile: Inference framework for exoplanets and stars
tools.detailed_description: A wrapper package for modeling and fitting photometric and radial velocity data. It integrates various samplers (emcee, dynesty) and models (ellc, celerite) to perform inference on exoplanets and binary stars.

tools.name: MCMC
tools.one_line_profile: C++ implementation of the MCMC hammer algorithm
tools.detailed_description: A C++ implementation of the affine-invariant ensemble sampler for Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC), commonly known as the 'MCMC hammer' (emcee algorithm). It provides a high-performance sampling tool for statistical inference.

tools.name: river
tools.one_line_profile: ML-based GW parameter estimation
tools.detailed_description: A tool for parameter estimation of gravitational waves using machine learning. It aims to provide rapid inference capabilities for GW signals.

tools.name: BnsLib
tools.one_line_profile: PyCBC-based library for BNS/BBH ML analysis
tools.detailed_description: A library built on top of PyCBC for processing binary neutron star (BNS) and binary black hole (BBH) gravitational wave data, specifically tailored for machine learning applications.

tools.name: lss_montepython
tools.one_line_profile: LSS likelihoods for MontePython
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Large-Scale Structure (LSS) likelihood modules designed for the MontePython cosmological inference code, enabling the use of LSS data for parameter constraints.

tools.name: BaCoN
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Cosmological Network for power spectra classification
tools.detailed_description: BAyesian COsmological Network (BaCoN) is a machine learning tool that uses Bayesian neural networks to classify power spectra into different cosmological models (e.g., dark energy, modified gravity).

tools.name: peregrine
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation-based inference for gravitational waves
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing Simulation-Based Inference (SBI) on gravitational wave signals. It enables efficient parameter estimation for a wide class of GW signals using neural posterior estimation.

tools.name: saqqara
tools.one_line_profile: SBI library for stochastic GW background
tools.detailed_description: A Simulation-Based Inference (SBI) library specifically designed for analyzing the stochastic gravitational wave background (SGWB). It facilitates the inference of SGWB parameters using simulation-based methods.

tools.name: gravpop
tools.one_line_profile: GW population inference with minimal edge bias
tools.detailed_description: A tool for gravitational-wave population inference that is designed to handle narrow population features while minimizing edge bias effects in the inferred distributions.

tools.name: reddemcee
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive Parallel Tempering wrapper for emcee
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper for the emcee sampler that implements adaptive parallel tempering. It improves sampling efficiency for multimodal or difficult posterior distributions in Bayesian inference.

tools.name: PosteriorAgreement
tools.one_line_profile: Quantify consistency between posterior distributions
tools.detailed_description: A statistical tool to quantify whether the difference between two posterior distributions (1D or multidimensional) is consistent with zero, useful for tension analysis in cosmology and other fields.

tools.name: Shamrock
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-GPU hydrodynamics framework for astrophysics
tools.detailed_description: An open-source, multi-GPU hydrodynamics framework designed for astrophysics simulations. It supports SPH (Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics) and AMR (Adaptive Mesh Refinement) and scales from laptops to supercomputers.

tools.name: mbDenoise
tools.one_line_profile: Microbiome data denoising method
tools.detailed_description: A statistical method and R package for denoising microbiome data. It uses a zero-inflated probabilistic PCA (ZIPPCA) model to address issues like zero-inflation, overdispersion, and unequal sequencing depth in microbiome count matrices.

tools.name: PopFisher
tools.one_line_profile: Fisher-matrix formalism for GW population inference
tools.detailed_description: A tool implementing the Fisher-matrix formalism for gravitational-wave population inference. It allows for fast forecasting of population constraints without full Bayesian sampling.

tools.name: psd
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive sine-multitaper power spectral density estimation
tools.detailed_description: An R package for computing adaptive, sine-multitaper power spectral density (PSD) estimates. It is useful for spectral analysis of time series data in geophysics and other scientific fields.

tools.name: mbb_emcee
tools.one_line_profile: Modified blackbody model implementation for MCMC sampling
tools.detailed_description: A specialized Python code implementing a modified blackbody model for use with the emcee MCMC sampler, typically used in astrophysical contexts like dust emission analysis.

tools.name: CosmoPower
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning accelerated Bayesian inference for cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A library for accelerating Bayesian inference in cosmology using machine learning emulators to replace computationally expensive likelihood evaluations.

tools.name: BAT.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Analysis Toolkit in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive toolkit for Bayesian analysis in Julia, providing algorithms for sampling, integration, and optimization, suitable for high-energy physics and other scientific domains.

tools.name: Monte Python
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological parameter inference code
tools.detailed_description: A Monte Carlo code for Cosmological Parameter extraction, interfacing with the Boltzmann code CLASS. It allows for Bayesian inference using various cosmological datasets.

tools.name: bilby
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inference library for gravitational-wave astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A user-friendly Bayesian inference library designed for gravitational-wave astronomy, providing a unified interface to various stochastic samplers.

tools.name: powsimR
tools.one_line_profile: Power analysis for RNA-seq experiments
tools.detailed_description: A flexible tool to simulate and evaluate differential expression from bulk and single-cell RNA-seq data for power analysis.

tools.name: BISIP
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inversion for spectral induced polarization data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for the Bayesian inversion of spectral induced polarization (SIP) laboratory data, used in geophysics.

tools.name: CosmoMC
tools.one_line_profile: MCMC parameter sampling code for cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran 2003 Markov-Chain Monte-Carlo (MCMC) engine for exploring cosmological parameter space, often used with CAMB.

tools.name: GetDist
tools.one_line_profile: MCMC sample analysis and plotting tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for analysing Monte Carlo samples, including correlated samples from Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC). It provides tools for kernel density estimation and plotting.

tools.name: CosmoHammer
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological parameter estimation framework
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for cosmological parameter estimation using the MCMC Hammer (emcee).

tools.name: pypower
tools.one_line_profile: Power spectrum and window function estimation
tools.detailed_description: A package for estimating power spectra and window functions, typically used in large-scale structure cosmology.

tools.name: emcee
tools.one_line_profile: Affine-invariant ensemble MCMC sampler
tools.detailed_description: A pure-Python implementation of Goodman & Weare's Affine Invariant Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) Ensemble sampler, widely used in astrophysics.

tools.name: emcee-jax
tools.one_line_profile: JAX implementation of the emcee sampler
tools.detailed_description: An experimental implementation of the emcee affine-invariant MCMC sampler using JAX for hardware acceleration and automatic differentiation.

tools.name: Dingo
tools.one_line_profile: Deep inference for gravitational-wave observations
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for deep learning-based parameter estimation of gravitational wave signals, using neural posterior estimation.

tools.name: bayes-kit
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inference and posterior analysis tools
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools for Bayesian inference and posterior analysis, developed at the Flatiron Institute.

tools.name: BCEA
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Cost Effectiveness Analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R package for Bayesian Cost Effectiveness Analysis, producing health economic evaluations from posterior distributions of costs and clinical benefits.

tools.name: 1-OGC
tools.one_line_profile: First Open Gravitational-wave Catalog
tools.detailed_description: The First Open Gravitational-wave Catalog of Compact Binary Mergers from Advanced LIGO's first observing run.

tools.name: 4-OGC
tools.one_line_profile: Fourth Open Gravitational-wave Catalog
tools.detailed_description: The Fourth Open Gravitational-wave Catalog of Compact Binary Mergers, including detected mergers and sub-threshold candidates from LIGO and Virgo data.

tools.name: gwapps
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive Web Apps to Explore Gravitational Waves
tools.detailed_description: A collection of interactive web applications designed to explore and visualize gravitational wave data.

tools.name: gwin
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inference package for gravitational-wave data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing Bayesian inference on gravitational-wave data.

tools.name: PyCBC
tools.one_line_profile: Core package for gravitational-wave data analysis and signal detection
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive software package used to analyze gravitational-wave data, detect signals, and estimate their parameters. It was instrumental in the first direct detection of gravitational waves and continues to be a standard tool in LIGO/Virgo data analysis.

tools.name: PyCBC PyLAL
tools.one_line_profile: Stripped-down LALSuite library functionality for PyCBC
tools.detailed_description: A library providing specific functionalities from the LALSuite (LIGO Algorithm Library) adapted for use within the PyCBC ecosystem, facilitating gravitational wave data analysis.

tools.name: PyCBC Waveform Errors Plugin
tools.one_line_profile: Plugin for PyCBC to incorporate waveform errors in inference
tools.detailed_description: A plugin designed for PyCBC to account for waveform model uncertainties during the parameter estimation process of gravitational wave analysis.

tools.name: gwkokab
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based gravitational-wave population inference toolkit
tools.detailed_description: An open-source toolkit leveraging JAX for efficient population inference of gravitational wave sources using parametric models, enabling accelerated computation.

tools.name: bayesfast
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Bayesian posterior sampling and evidence estimation tools
tools.detailed_description: Next-generation Bayesian analysis tools designed to accelerate posterior sampling and evidence estimation, particularly useful for high-dimensional cosmological or physical parameter spaces.

tools.name: VItamin
tools.one_line_profile: Fast gravitational wave parameter estimation using variational inference
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning-based tool for rapid Bayesian parameter estimation of gravitational waves using variational inference techniques, significantly faster than traditional sampling methods.

tools.name: cINNamon
tools.one_line_profile: Invertible neural network for gravitational wave parameter estimation
tools.detailed_description: A tool utilizing conditional Invertible Neural Networks (cINNs) to perform rapid and accurate parameter estimation for gravitational wave signals.

tools.name: cosmoped
tools.one_line_profile: Compressed CMB likelihood code using MOPED compression
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that implements the MOPED (Massively Optimised Parameter Estimation and Data compression) scheme to compress Planck power spectrum data for efficient CMB likelihood evaluation.

tools.name: bilby (genomics)
tools.one_line_profile: Jax-based machine learning code for functional genomics
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning toolkit implemented in Jax, specifically designed for functional genomics analysis. (Note: Distinct from the gravitational-wave 'bilby' package).

tools.name: SimpleMC
tools.one_line_profile: Simple MCMC code for cosmological parameter estimation
tools.detailed_description: A simplified Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) code designed for cosmological parameter estimation, focusing on expansion history constraints.

tools.name: xspec_emcee
tools.one_line_profile: Interface to use emcee for XSPEC spectral analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that bridges the XSPEC X-ray spectral fitting package with the emcee MCMC sampler, enabling Bayesian analysis of X-ray spectra.

tools.name: dynesty
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic Nested Sampling package for Bayesian inference
tools.detailed_description: A pure Python implementation of Dynamic Nested Sampling, used for estimating Bayesian posteriors and evidences (marginal likelihoods), widely used in astronomy and cosmology.

tools.name: SNTD
tools.one_line_profile: Supernova Time Delays measurement package
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for measuring time delays in strongly lensed and multiply-imaged supernovae, including simulation, fitting, and cosmological constraint propagation.

tools.name: cogwheel
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient gravitational wave likelihood evaluation using harmonics
tools.detailed_description: A tool for combining gravitational wave harmonics to enable efficient evaluation of likelihood functions in parameter estimation.

tools.name: bayestack
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian stacking software for astronomical data
tools.detailed_description: A flexible, fully Bayesian software package designed for stacking analysis of astronomical data sets to infer population properties.

tools.name: jim
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based gravitational-wave data analysis tools
tools.detailed_description: A suite of gravitational-wave data analysis tools implemented in JAX, enabling hardware acceleration and automatic differentiation for efficient inference.

tools.name: GetDistr
tools.one_line_profile: Fragment size distribution calculator for genomics
tools.detailed_description: A tool to calculate the distribution of observed fragment sizes or insert sizes in various scenarios, aiding in structural variant calling and genome assembly.

tools.name: relativebilbying
tools.one_line_profile: Relative binning plugin for Bilby
tools.detailed_description: A plugin code to incorporate the relative binning technique into the Bilby gravitational-wave inference library, improving computational efficiency.

tools.name: nrutils_dev
tools.one_line_profile: Python API for low-level analysis of Numerical Relativity data
tools.detailed_description: A Python API designed for the low-level analysis of Numerical Relativity (NR) data, including Psi4 extraction, strain calculation, and interfaces with LAL and PyCBC.

tools.name: CMBLensing.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable and GPU-compatible CMB lensing analysis toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A Julia toolkit for Cosmic Microwave Background (CMB) lensing analysis that supports automatic differentiation and GPU acceleration, facilitating advanced inference tasks.

tools.name: cosmoslik
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmology Sampler of Likelihoods
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for cosmological parameter estimation, providing tools for sampling likelihoods and interfacing with various cosmological data sets.

tools.name: bajes
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Jenaer software for gravitational wave inference
tools.detailed_description: A Python pipeline for Bayesian inference of gravitational-wave and multi-messenger astronomy data, supporting various sampling methods and models.

tools.name: KissMCMC.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Simple MCMC implementation in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, 'Keep It Simple, Stupid' Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) library for Julia, designed for ease of use in general Bayesian inference problems.

tools.name: pocoMC
tools.one_line_profile: Preconditioned Monte Carlo for accelerated Bayesian Computation
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Preconditioned Monte Carlo method, designed to accelerate Bayesian computation and posterior sampling for complex models.

tools.name: zeus
tools.one_line_profile: Lightning Fast MCMC Ensemble Slice Sampler
tools.detailed_description: A fast and efficient Python implementation of the Ensemble Slice Sampling method for MCMC, suitable for cosmological and astrophysical parameter estimation.

tools.name: nessai
tools.one_line_profile: Nested Sampling with Artificial Intelligence
tools.detailed_description: A nested sampling algorithm that uses normalizing flows (AI) to accelerate the sampling process, particularly for gravitational-wave inference.

tools.name: pocomc-bilby
tools.one_line_profile: PocoMC plugin for Bilby
tools.detailed_description: A plugin that interfaces the PocoMC sampler with the Bilby gravitational-wave inference library, allowing Bilby users to utilize Preconditioned Monte Carlo.

tools.name: gaussbock
tools.one_line_profile: Fast parallel-iterative cosmological parameter estimation
tools.detailed_description: A tool for fast, parallel-iterative cosmological parameter estimation utilizing Bayesian nonparametrics to accelerate inference.

tools.name: ENTERPRISE
tools.one_line_profile: Pulsar timing analysis and gravitational-wave search toolbox
tools.detailed_description: Enhanced Numerical Toolbox Enabling a Robust PulsaR Inference SuitE (ENTERPRISE) is a pulsar timing analysis code aimed at noise analysis, gravitational-wave searches, and timing model analysis. It uses Bayesian inference methods to analyze pulsar timing array data.

tools.name: Full-Shape Likelihoods
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological power spectrum and bispectrum likelihoods
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing full-shape power spectrum and bispectrum likelihoods for cosmological parameter inference, typically used with large-scale structure data.

tools.name: revdbayes
tools.one_line_profile: Ratio-of-Uniforms Sampling for Bayesian Extreme Value Analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing functions for the Bayesian analysis of extreme value models using Ratio-of-Uniforms sampling. It facilitates posterior simulation for extreme value distributions.

tools.name: lollipop
tools.one_line_profile: Cobaya likelihood for Planck 2020 NPIPE low-ell polarization data
tools.detailed_description: A specialized likelihood module for the Cobaya sampling framework, designed to handle low-ell polarized data from the Planck 2020 NPIPE release for cosmological inference.

tools.name: welch-sde
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral density and power spectrum estimation in Rust
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library for spectral density estimation using Welch's method, useful for analyzing time-series data in physics and astronomy.

tools.name: uvmcmcfit
tools.one_line_profile: MCMC fitting for interferometric observations and gravitational lensing
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that uses emcee to fit parametric models to interferometric observations of astronomical sources, specifically designed to account for gravitational lensing effects.

tools.name: victor
tools.one_line_profile: Likelihood analysis for void-galaxy cross-correlation
tools.detailed_description: Python code for performing likelihood analysis and MCMC posterior sampling specifically for void-galaxy cross-correlation data in cosmology.

tools.name: MGCobaya
tools.one_line_profile: Modified Gravity (MGCAMB) interface for Cobaya
tools.detailed_description: An interface allowing the use of MGCAMB (Modified Gravity Code for Anisotropies in the Microwave Background) within the Cobaya Bayesian analysis framework.

tools.name: GWXtreme
tools.one_line_profile: Inference tools for extreme matter using GW data
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for performing inferences on extreme matter properties (e.g., neutron stars) using gravitational wave parameter estimation data.

tools.name: rust-emcee
tools.one_line_profile: Rust implementation of the emcee MCMC sampler
tools.detailed_description: A pure Rust re-implementation of the popular Python affine-invariant ensemble MCMC sampler 'emcee', providing high-performance sampling capabilities.

tools.name: paltas
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation-based inference for strong gravitational lensing
tools.detailed_description: A package to conduct simulation-based inference on strong gravitational lensing systems, generating realistic simulations for training machine learning models.

tools.name: ggwd
tools.one_line_profile: Synthetic gravitational-wave data generator
tools.detailed_description: A tool that wraps PyCBC and LALSuite to generate synthetic gravitational-wave data, specifically designed for machine learning applications.

tools.name: procoli
tools.one_line_profile: Profile likelihood extractor for MontePython
tools.detailed_description: Code for extracting the 1D profile likelihood of cosmological parameters using the MontePython sampler output.

tools.name: kosmo-kompress
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological field compression using IMNN
tools.detailed_description: A tool leveraging Information Maximising Neural Networks (IMNN) for optimal compression of cosmological fields and subsequent Bayesian inference of parameters.

tools.name: PACT
tools.one_line_profile: Posterior Analysis of Coalescent Trees
tools.detailed_description: A Mathematica package for the posterior analysis of coalescent trees, used in phylogenetics and evolutionary biology to infer population dynamics.

tools.name: bayes_spec
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Spectral Line Modeling Framework
tools.detailed_description: A Bayesian framework for modeling spectral lines in astronomical data, enabling probabilistic inference of physical parameters from spectra.

tools.name: pySODM
tools.one_line_profile: Simulating and Optimising Dynamical Models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for simulating and optimizing dynamical models, often used in epidemiology (e.g., COVID-19 modeling) and social dynamics.

tools.name: peregrine
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation-based inference for gravitational waves
tools.detailed_description: A simulation-based inference (SBI) library designed to perform analysis on a wide class of gravitational wave signals, enabling efficient parameter estimation.

tools.name: swyft
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable simulation-based inference system
tools.detailed_description: A system for scientific simulation-based inference (SBI) at scale, designed to handle complex physical simulations and perform efficient marginal posterior estimation.

tools.name: dmdd
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian analysis for dark matter direct detection
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for simulation and Bayesian posterior analysis of nuclear-recoil data from dark matter direct detection experiments.

tools.name: ptemcee
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel-tempered ensemble MCMC sampler
tools.detailed_description: A parallel-tempered version of the emcee MCMC sampler, designed to improve sampling efficiency for multimodal posterior distributions.

tools.name: spt_likelihoods
tools.one_line_profile: Cobaya likelihoods for South Pole Telescope data
tools.detailed_description: A collection of likelihood modules for the Cobaya framework, specifically for analyzing data from the South Pole Telescope (SPT) experiment.

tools.name: radex_emcee
tools.one_line_profile: MCMC modeling of molecular lines using RADEX
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool combining the RADEX radiative transfer code with emcee to perform MCMC modeling of interstellar molecular lines.

tools.name: xspec_emcee
tools.one_line_profile: MCMC sampler implementation for XSPEC
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the emcee MCMC algorithm specifically designed to work within the XSPEC X-ray spectral fitting package.
